Identification_Area.title: Chepil Wind Tunnel at The High Plains Wind Erosion Laboratory, Kansas State University

Modification_Detail.description: Updated schema version. Adding missing "facility" references.
Initial creation of the context product.

External_Reference.reference_text: Chepil, W.S. (1959) Equilibrium of Soil Grains at the Threshold of Movement by Wind, Soil Science Society of America Journal, 23(6): 422-428.
Zingg, A. and W.S. Chepil, (1950), Aerodynamics of Wind Erosion, Agr. En., Vol.31, June 1950, pp. 279-282, 284.

Instrument.name: Chepil Wind Tunnel at The High Plains Wind Erosion Laboratory, Kansas State University
Instrument.description: The Chepil Wind Tunnel at the High Plains Wind Erosion Laboratory (HPWEL) at Kansas State University is a research facility designed to study wind erosion, soil movement, and the effects of wind on various surface materials, particularly in agricultural and desert environments.
